trans-unit.source: Provides a page adapter for the HTML adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET and must have a default constructor.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Value to be used as the default page weight.
Returns a list of any additional HTTP headers by which caching is varied.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter> classes inherit this property from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IPageAdapter> interface.
These implementations return `null`.
For more information, see the "Output Caching" section in [Mobile Text Writer Rendering Best Practices](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28893297-2c45-4c57-a2b3-9cdd5898f988).
A list of any additional HTTP headers by which caching is varied.
Gets or sets persisted data between requests through the use of the URL query string.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is populated when a valid <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> type is configured as an attribute of the `< mobileControls >` configuration element.
Data persisted between requests through the use of the URL query string.
Creates and returns a text writer suitable for the given adapters.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer.
A text writer suitable for the given adapters.
Called to determine the postback data collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Because some devices handle postback differently from others, this method allows the adapter to modify the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter> implementations of this method gather control data if the post originated from a different page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ChtmlPageAdapter> implementation performs CHTML-specific handling of postback data.
A <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest"></xref> object that contains request information, such as HTTP headers.
Source identifier for the event.
Argument identifier for the event.
Collection of postback data from the request object.
A modified version of the baseCollection parameter.
Evaluates whether the device adapter set applies to the specified request.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Class
Returns
Preferred rendering type
Check value of JavaScript property

Checks whether the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType%2A> property is <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeHtml32> or <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeChtml10>.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.JavaScript%2A> property returns `true`.

Checks whether the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType%2A> property is <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeHtml32> or <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeChtml10>.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.JavaScript%2A> property's device capability returns false.

Checks whether the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType%2A> property is <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeWml11> or <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeWml12>.
Not applicable.
The current request context.
`true` if the device adapter set applies to the specified request; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the key to use to submit the event argument.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If an inheriting adapter overrides this property, it must also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method to process the postback.
The key to use to submit the event argument.
Returns the key to use to submit the event source.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If an inheriting adapter overrides this property, it must also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method to process the postback.
The key to use to submit the event source.
Returns a URL that can be used to uniquely identify the form.

This URL must only be passed as a parameter to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MultiPartWriter.BeginFile(System.String,System.String,System.String)"></xref> method of the text writer.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The specified form.
A URL that can be used to uniquely identify the form.
Called if an unhandled exception occurs during the life cycle of the page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An adapter can choose to handle the exception and render an error message.
The method returns `true` if it handles the error.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter> class, this implementation does nothing and returns `false`.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter> class, this implementation formats the error for WML and returns `true`.
System exception object.
The text writer
`false` in all cases.
Returns `true` if it handles the exception.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Called during postback.
Allows a page adapter to handle a postback event by itself.

Both the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.HandlePagePostBackEvent%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter.HandlePagePostBackEvent%2A> methods return false.
Source identifier for the event.
Name of the event.
`false` in all cases.
Returns whether or not the specified form is to be rendered as part of the current request.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter> class, only the active form is rendered for each request.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter> class, multiple forms can be combined as cards into a single deck, if size permits.
Programmatic name of the form.
`true` if the specified form is to be rendered as part of the current request; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a page weight, based on the device's screen size, which is appropriate for the target device.
Used in form pagination.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The page weight, based on the device's screen size, which is appropriate for the target device.
Gets or sets the page to which the adapter is attached.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The page associated with the device adapter.
Sets or returns whether items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.CookielessDataDictionary"></xref> property are persisted in the query string.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

By default this value is `true` if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.CookielessDataDictionary%2A> entry in the `MobileControls` configuration section of Web.config is set to a valid dictionary type.
`true` if items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.CookielessDataDictionary"></xref> property are persisted in the query string; otherwise, `false`.
Called by the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)"></xref> method to perform rendering.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer to receive output.
Renders the given form.
Called by the form adapter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer.
The form to render.
Renders all hidden variables on the page as hidden input fields.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.RenderPostBackHeader%2A> method.
The text writer.
Renders a reference to a postback event appropriately for the target device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
On script-capable devices, the event is rendered as a call to a script function.
On other devices, the event is rendered as a URL.
The specified text writer.
The target device.
Optional event argument to pass.
Renders the header associated with postbacks.
For browsers that support script, this includes a script block to perform postback.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Called by the form adapter.
The text writer.
The unique identifier for the form.
Renders a reference to a postback event, as a URL.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Postbacks rendered as a URL do not submit dynamic form data, such as text-box contents, on postback.
To submit such data on postback on devices that do not support script, use an HTML `submit` button instead.
The text writer
The URL reference
Any hidden variables
